      • get1DIndex

        public static int get1DIndex(int py,
             int width,
             int px)
        Used for converting an x index and a y index into a single index for use in a 1D array.
        E.g.
         Image image = new Image(5, 10); // 5 width, 10 height
 byte data[] = image.getTexture().getTextureData();
 for (int y = 0; y < 10; ++y)
     for (int x = 0; x < 5; ++x)
         System.out.println(data[Point.get1DIndex(y, 5, x)]); // will print out indexes 0 to 50
        Parameters:
        py - - Index y
        width - - Width of a row in the 2D array
        px - - Index x
        Returns:
        - The 1D index
        See Also:
        get2DIndex(int, int, TPoint)

      • get2DIndex

        public static TPoint get2DIndex(int index,
                int width,
                TPoint point)
        Used for converting a single 1D index into a 2D index.
        E.g.
         Image image = new Image(5, 10); // 5 width, 10 height
 byte newdata[][] = new byte[image.getWidth()][image.getHeight()];
 byte data[] = image.getTexture().getTextureData();
 int len = data.length;
 for (int i = 0; i < len; ++i)
 {
     TPoint index = TPoint.get2DIndex(i, image.getWidth());
     newdata[index.x][index.y] = data[i];
 }
        Parameters:
        index - - The 1D index
        width - - The width of a row in the 2D array
        point - - The point to store the result in
        Returns:
        - The newly edited point

      • distance

        public static double distance(TPoint source,
              TPoint destination)
        Used to find the distance between two points, using the linear distance algorithm.
        Parameters:
        source - - The first point
        destination - - The second point
        Returns:
        - The distance between a and b, square rooted

      • length

        public static double length(TPoint point)
        Used by distance(TPoint, TPoint), normalize(TPoint), and normalizeDestination(TPoint, TPoint) to find the length for a single point.
        Parameters:
        point - - The point to find the length of
        Returns:
        - A double representing the length

        destination - - The point to arrive at
        Returns:

      • transformRotate

                     TPoint source)

        Parameters:

                     float sourceX,
                     float sourceY)
